verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. The fool<WH5036> hath said<WH559> in his heart<WH3820>, There is no God<WH430>. They are corrupt<WH7843>, they have done abominable<WH8581> works<WH5949>; There is none that doeth<WH6213> good<WH2896>.

Jehovah <WH3068> looked down<WH8259> from heaven<WH8064> upon the children<WH1121> of men<WH120>, To see<WH7200> if there<WH3426> were any that did understand<WH7919>, That did seek<WH1875> after God<WH430>.
They are all gone aside<WH5493>; They are together<WH3162> become filthy<WH444>; There is none that doeth<WH6213> good<WH2896>, no<WH259>, not one.
Have all the workers<WH6466> of iniquity<WH205> no knowledge<WH3045>, Who eat up<WH398> my people<WH5971> as they eat<WH398> bread<WH3899>, And call<WH7121> not upon Jehovah<WH3068>?
There were they in great<WH6343> fear<WH6342>; For God<WH430> is in the generation<WH1755> of the righteous<WH6662>.
Ye put to shame<WH954> the counsel<WH6098> of the poor<WH6041>, Because Jehovah<WH3068> is his refuge<WH4268>.

Oh that<WH5414> the salvation<WH3444> of Israel<WH3478> were come out of Zion<WH6726>! When Jehovah<WH3068> bringeth back<WH7725> the captivity<WH7622> of his people<WH5971>, Then shall Jacob<WH3290> rejoice<WH1523>, and Israel<WH3478> shall be glad<WH8055>.
